basics.name: Reed Geisler
basics.label: Medical Student
basics.summary: Hello! I am a fourth year medical student at The Ohio State University College of Medicine.

work.summary: Elected Class President for third-year medical students, member of academic policy and facilities committees. Re-elected president for fourth year of medical school.
Appointed representative to the American Association of Medical Colleges Organization of Student Representatives.
Established workflow for project pipeline.
Established program to collaborate with engineering school design projects.
Held procedural skills events to expose students to anesthesiology.
Established mentorship program connecting medical students and residents.

work.company: Internal Medicine Ultrasound Community of Practice
work.summary: Focused on applications of ultrasound to critical care and internal medicine.
Advocated for access to abortion in Ohio.
Organized movie events for medical student wellness.

work.company: UCARE (Ultrasound: Clinical, Administrative, Research, Education) Program
work.summary: Joined program for more in-depth ultrasound experience as a medical student.

work.company: The Ohio State University College of Medicine Department of Educational Technology
work.summary: Initiated and completed a migration of lecture media resources onto a platform to consolidate lecture materials and allow additional functionality for students.

work.company: University of Cambridge, Graduate School of Life Sciences
work.summary: Founded the GRAduate Student and Postdoctoral Forum (GRASP), a community for personal and professional development of graduate and postgraduate members of the life sciences disciplines at the University of Cambridge.

work.position: Faculty Board Member, Graduate Operations Committee Member, School Council
work.summary: Elected by the graduate student body of the Clinical School at the University of Cambridge to represent student interests at meetings of the School Council, Graduate Operations Committee, and Faculty Board. In concert, these committees direct future direction of the clinical school.

work.company: University of Cambridge, Churchill College Middle Common Room, 'The Vicious Penguin'
work.summary: Worked weekly as a bartender for the graduate student community of Churchill College at the University of Cambridge.
Supervised and led the oldest group of Camp Kesem participants (14-16 years of age) during camp. Camp Kesem is a community organization that supports children through cancer in their family.

Supervised summer session teenage participants in the Cornell Adult University program. Provided medical care and ensured students were taking prescribed medications during the program, an average of sixty students each week.

Managed a budget of $60,000 for Cornell's Class of 2017 Council. Initiated a tiered mentorship program with treasurers of younger class councils to facilitate education about the role and communication of resources between councils.

Worked collaboratively with an administrator and fourteen student members of the Orientation Steering Committee to plan all logistics of Cornell Orientation, from recruitment and training of volunteers to all aspects of event registration and advertisement.
Worked as an undergraduate teaching assistant in PSYCH 1101, Introductory Psychology. Proctored all exams, led review sessions, and held weekly office hours for students in the course.

work.position: Undergraduate and Graduate Teaching Assistant, Autotutorial Physics
work.summary: Worked for four semesters as an undergraduate and graduate teaching assistant in PHYS 1101-1102, the course sequence for students self-teaching ('Auto-tutorial') Introductory Physics. Due to the necessarily open curriculum of the course and lack of lectures, I worked with several other teaching assistants to establish weekly review sessions, staff the course study/lab space, and address student concerns re:lab equipment and demos. One of the highest-rated teaching assistants for all four semesters.
Worked as a summer student in the Freeman lab. Performed initial synthesis and in vitro testing on a novel drug candidate.

work.company: Cornell Genetically Engineered Machines (iGEM) Project Team
work.summary: Business team lead and wetlab team member for Cornell iGEM Synthetic Biology Project Team. While working as the business team lead, our team's project earned a gold medal, best entrepreneurship, best environmental project, and best applied design awards in the annual international synthetic biology competition (iGEM Jamboree).

Founded the Academic Policy Committee with collaboration from undergraduate representatives of Cornell's College of Arts & Sciences to the Student Assembly. Initiated the committee with a resolution that altered the structure of introductory biology and chemistry coursework at the university.
Organized fundraising for students to attend service-learning trips for rural communities in Nicaragua.
Worked as sober monitor and trained employees to ensure a safe environment at college events.

work.company: Cornell University, Department of Biological Sciences
work.summary: Paid tutor for study groups of introductory biology coursework.
Organized events and maintenance at undergraduate housing communities.

work.company: Boyce Thompson Institute for Plant Research
work.summary: Performed low=level duties for lab maintenance.

volunteer.summary: Led a project to facilitate dental care screening and access to patients at a free clinic.
Biweekly medical student volunteer at Columbus Free Clinic.

Worked shifts on university ambulance (a student-run, Basic Life Support, non-transporting first response agency) as an EMT-Basic. Responsible for performing effective and prompt frontline care in both transport and non-transport scenarios.
Worked on Dryden and Bangs ambulance services as Advanced EMT student, leading response to Advanced Life Support (ALS) and Basic Life Support (BLS) emergencies.
Taught students through Algebra, Mindfulness & Meditation, and a study hall course at Auburn Correctional Facility.
Volunteered weekly for various activities (e.g. Second Wind cottages, street clean-up).
Trained to work on undergraduate college crisis line.
Worked as Emergency Department greeter and volunteer.

volunteer.organization: Motivating Action Through Community Health Outreach (MACHO)
volunteer.summary: Taught students ranging in age from six to twelve years old in Harlem, New York City, about basic nutrition, health, and skills for healthy living through basic demonstrations of body systems and teaching them how to prepare healthy meals on a low budget (given $2/student/day).
Performed outreach activities to raise awareness for affordable housing lotteries and developments in Greenpoint, Bedford-Stuyvesant, and Manhattan neighborhoods in New York City.
Worked shifts on hometown ambulance (an Advanced Life Support, transporting and first response agency) as an EMT-Basic. Left service to attend university.
Worked in several nursing wards and patient transport, learned about hospital care in a non-emergency setting.
Volunteering in patient transport and ambulatory surgery.

education.institution: The Ohio State University, College of Medicine

education.studyType: Research Assistant in Cancer Research UK Cambridge Institute

education.institution: Cornell University, College of Arts & Sciences
education.area: Chemistry & Chemical Biology / Biological Sciences with Concentration in Biochemistry

awards.title: Roessler Medical Student Research Scholarship
awards.awarder: The Ohio State University College of Medicine
awards.summary: Awarded a competitive summer research scholarship for the study of white matter recovery following ischemic stroke.

awards.title: Cornell University Class of 2017 Banner Bearer
awards.summary: Awarded as one of two banner bearers for the Class of 2017 graduation procession.

awards.title: Best Entrepreneurship, Best Applied Design, Best Environmental Project, Gold Medal
awards.summary: Awarded in athe annual international undergraduate and graduate synthetic biology competition of iGEM while the Business Team Lead of Cornell iGEM, for a multi-targeted approach to the reduction of bacterial cold water disease in salmonid fish.

awards.title: Meinig Family Cornell National Scholar
awards.summary: One of four rising junior undergraduates selected for admission into the Meinig Family Cornell National Scholars program, a merit-based scholarship to foster community leadership.

awards.title: Zeta Psi Scholars in New York City Fellow
awards.summary: Summer scholarship funding to offset living expenses of an unpaid internship in New York City during Summer 2014.

awards.title: Zeta Psi Educational Foundation Scholarship
awards.summary: Merit- and need-based tuition scholarship for undergraduate study.

awards.title: Finalist, Cornell Venture Challenge
awards.summary: Finalist in venture competition, for a project involving a redesign of the spinal pedicle probe in spinal fixation surgeries.

awards.title: Pauline & Irving Tanner Dean's Scholar
awards.awarder: Cornell University College of Arts & Sciences
awards.summary: Merit award presented to 2% of admitted students to Cornell University's College of Arts & Sciences on admission to the Class of 2017.

awards.title: National AP Scholar, AP Scholar with Distinction
awards.summary: Awarded for completing at least 8 AP exams with a high average score (all scores earned were 5/5).

awards.title: Latin Honor Society
awards.summary: Awarded for academic achievement in Latin coursework throughout high school.
